page.title: 01North Peterhead
page.content: There is a marked difference between this and lands to the North. Trees plentiful and the land undulates giving a pleasant view. Good farmland with mixed farming. Best Buchan beef is fattened on these lands. Town dwellers have spread into private housing estates, also to Inverugie, a real haven in this bleak corner of Scotland. The River Ugie flows through wheat and barley fields, and is well fished, it reaches the sea at Peterhead with a golf course, beach and long esplanade. A heliport services North Sea Oil platforms but gives no public service. Traffic is heavy - lots of families have two cars. Virtually no unemployment, light engineering and a large supermarket gives work to a few, most are fishermen, oil related workers or professional people.
